service.title: HTTP Cache-Control Extensions for Stale Content
service.documentation: This document defines two independent HTTP Cache-Control extensions that allow control over the use of stale responses by caches.

http-cache-directive.documentation: When present in an HTTP response, the stale-while-revalidate Cache-Control extension indicates that caches MAY serve the response in which it appears after it becomes stale, up to the indicated number of seconds.
The stale-if-error Cache-Control extension indicates that when an error is encountered, a cached stale response MAY be used to satisfy the request, regardless of other freshness information.
